alert.note: Alert for Bath; Fleming; Rowan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 6:17AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Bath, southeastern Fleming and western Rowan Counties through 645 AM EDT... At 617 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bethel, or 11 miles northwest of Owingsville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Owingsville, Pebble, Sherburne and Reynoldsville around 625 AM EDT. Oakley, Wyoming, Odessa, Slate Valley and Craigs around 630 AM EDT. Marshall, Grange City, Hillsboro, Peasticks and Polksville around 635 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Salt Lick, Sharkey, Ringos Mills, Ramey, Moore`s Ferry, Plummers Landing, Midland, Hilda, Bluestone, Freestone and Farmers. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 122 and 136. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
